net.proteusframework.ui.miwt.component.composite

Class MessageContainer

  • java.lang.Object
    • net.proteusframework.ui.miwt.component.ComponentImpl
      • net.proteusframework.ui.miwt.component.Container
        • net.proteusframework.ui.miwt.component.composite.MessageContainer
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    PropertyChangeListener, Iterable<Component>, EventListener, LocaleContextSource, Notifiable<Component>, Component, ComponentListener, ListCellRenderer, ParentComponent, TableCellRenderer, TreeCellRenderer, ActionListener

    @UIElement(supportsAction=false,
           name="messages")
public class MessageContainer
extends Container
implements ActionListener, ComponentListener, Notifiable<Component>
    Manages Message or Notification objects and renders them.
    Author:
    Pat B. Double (double@i2rd.com)

      • actionPerformed

        Handles timer notification.
        Specified by:

        ev - the event.

      • add

        public MessageContainer add(Message... messages)
        Add a message. If an expire interval is set the expire time for the message will be set accordingly, unless the expire time is already set for the message. If the preset expire time for the message has already expired it is replaced by that computed from the expire interval. Note that it is required to set a positive expire interval in order to activate expiration, setting the message expire time is not sufficient.
        Parameters:
        messages - the message to add.
        Returns:
        this for chaining.

      • add

        public MessageContainer add(NotificationType type,
                            LocalizedObjectKey key,
                            Object... arguments)
        Add a message to the container. See add(Message...) for details.
        Parameters:
        type - the message type.
        key - the message text key.
        arguments - the arguments to use when resolving the key, may be empty. See LocaleContext.getLocalizedText(LocalizedObjectKey, Object[]) .
        Returns:
        this for chaining.

      • checkValidators

        public boolean checkValidators(Component root)
        Checks the validators of the component tree rooted at the argument. All messages are cleared and any failed validations will create error messages in this container.
        Parameters:
        root - the root of the component tree to validate.
        Returns:
        true if all components are valid, false if any one or more of the components are invalid.

      • clearMessages

        public MessageContainer clearMessages()
        Remove components that were added for messages. Other components are not changed.
        Returns:
        this for chaining.

      • gather

        public static List<Message> gather(Component root)
        Gather Message objects from all MessageContainer instances in the tree. The components need not be visible.
        Parameters:
        root - the root of the component tree.
        Returns:
        list of messages.

      • getExpireInterval

        public long getExpireInterval()
        Get the interval in milliseconds after which messages should be expired and removed from the component. A value of zero or less disables expiration.
        Returns:
        interval in milliseconds.

      • init

        public void init()
        Description copied from interface: Component

        Called when a Component is first attached to a WindowManager. This means the Component should have valid return values from getApplication(), getLocaleContext(), getParent(). It is preferable to have all construction of the Component go here since a valid LocaleContext, Application object, etc., are available.

        When overriding this method, be sure to call the super class init(). init() is called only once for each Component. The parent component will have been init()ed before init() is called.

        NOTE: Do not call this method from application code. It is meant to be called by the WindowManager only.

        Specified by:
        init in interface Component
        Overrides:
        init in class ComponentImpl

                   HTMLRenderContext context)
        Description copied from interface: Component

        Parameters:

        context - The rendering context.

      • sendNotification

        public void sendNotification(Notification notification)
        Specified by:
        sendNotification in interface Notifiable<Component>

      • setExpireInterval

        public void setExpireInterval(long expireInterval)
        Get the interval in milliseconds after which messages should be expired and removed from the component. A value of zero or less disables expiration. Note that each message has an expire time, this method will not modify the expire time of existing messages.
        Parameters:
        expireInterval - the interval to set, zero or less to disable.
